intro: Maba multibracteata, commonly known as the African maba tree, is a deciduous tree native to sub-Saharan Africa. It belongs to the family Sterculiaceae and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, yellowish-white flowers. The tree produces woody capsules that contain numerous flat, elongated seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in savanna and woodland areas. The plant is valued for its timber and has traditional uses in local communities.
